The Battle of Dhi Qar (), also known as the '''War of the Camel's Udder''', was a pre-Islamic battle fought between Arab tribes and the Sasanian Empire in Southern Iraq. The battle occurred after the death of Al-Nu'man III by the orders of Khosru II.
The dating of the event is disputed. The Encyclopædia Iranica entry on the subject says:
}}
The battle of Dhū-Qār is reported in many classical works of Arabic history and literature. The longest, but not necessarily most representative, version is Bishr ibn Marwān al-Asadī's Ḥarb Banī Shaybān maʻa Kisrá Ānūshirwān ().
